intro: Linzia ituriensis var. occidentalis, commonly known as the western ituri linzia, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant features showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or white, and it produces capsule fruits containing small, hairy seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of dense tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
